Click Events - Change Color

Click Me!
var box1 = document.getElementById('js_examplebox1');
box1.addEventListener('click', function (){
 if (box1.style.background == 'red'){
  box1.style.background = 'blue';
 }else{
  box1.style.background = 'red';
 }
})

Here we have a simple function that checks the current background color when the box is clicked. If the current color is red, it changes it to blue. Otherwise, it changes it to red.

Use - document.getElementById - to select the element that will be used to trigger the event.

Use - .addEventListener() - to describe which type of event you want to 'listen' for.
